name: Lego cloud sculpture: Nuage
description:
+++ TITLE +++
"Nuage" from the "LEGO cloud" series

+++ ARTIST +++
Erik Maldre

+++ ARTIST STATEMENT +++
LEGO pieces and clouds are opposites by their form. LEGO pieces are plastic, rigid, geometrically modular standardized units mass produced by man. Clouds are biomorphic, fluid, randomly shaped forms of water and ice produced by nature.

However, what makes these extremes similar is their symbolic meaning. LEGO and clouds represent the creative dreams and aspirations of children of all ages.

Each LEGO cloud sculpture in the series is titled after the word, "cloud" in a foreign language. This evokes the notion that LEGO is a universal toy and clouds are universal elements.

+++ SIZE +++
z" length x z" depth x z" height

+++ MEDIUM +++
LEGO 2x4 bricks adhered together with permanent glue

+++ ORIGINAL +++
This is an original sculpture signed by the artist.

+++ EDITION +++
This sculpture is part of an edition. The edition number is featured on the same brick as the signature. Each sculpture in the series is being sold starting with 01. The number sculpture you receive depends on how many sculptures were previously sold in this specific series.

+++ GUARANTEE +++
The artist has personally created and signed each sculpture so you are guaranteed the highest quality art. Satisfaction is guaranteed or a refund (minus shipping costs) will be given.

+++ BIO +++
Erik Maldre, 31, born and raised in Chicago, Illinois USA has a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree from Illinois Wesleyan University. His work has been exhibited in a variety of locations from the conceptual Fassbender Gallery in Chicago to various site installations in churches in the Chicagoland area. His art is found in collections nationally and internationally including England and Spain. He currently resides in a near-west suburb of Chicago and works full-time as a Senior Art Director.

Visit Erik's website, artis3letters.com, to get a better understanding of his work. His blog is updated every single weekday at unlikelymoose.com/blog. You'll find discussions about art, design, technology and a lot more in-between. It's a Chicago-style hot dog blog.

+++ COPYRIGHT +++
All artwork by Erik Maldre is copyrighted and may not be produced in any form without his written permission. All rights of reproduction stay with Erik Maldre.

name: SWEIKI from Properties of Language
description:
+++ TITLE +++
"Sweiki" from the series, "Properties of Language"

+++ ARTIST +++
Erik Maldre

+++ ARTIST STATEMENT +++
"Properties of Language"
This series delves into the mysteries of language featuring two contrasting subject matters. The embedded RAM chips symbolize computer language. Communication streams have rapidly evolved in the last 20 years into an expeditious, instantaneous form of contact through the cold, impersonal, abstract means of technology. The white, hand-written language goes in the opposite direction. Its forms are inspired by elegant, handwritten Latvian messages on postcards from the early 20th century.

However, there are commonalities between these subject matters. Both languages can be difficult to master. Despite the strong presence of technology in today's world, essentially no single person has mastered all the programming languages used to drive it. The Latvian language was chosen for this series because of its notorious reputation for being onerous to learn. This is further emphasized by the interpretative direction used in representing these Latvian postcards through abstracted, sumptuous curvatures and rhythmical delights.

It's in the representation of rhythmical delights that both subject matters geminate. Both forms feature repetition of shapes and forms found in the exact, rigid quadforms of the RAM and the elegant, ascenders and descenders of the handwriting.

Also, both languages studied here can die off with the passage of time. In fact, thousands of programming languages have come and gone in the last 50 years. The languages of eastern Europe have seen their share of dialects come and go during their tenure.

The RAM and handwriting contrast and compare in various symbolic and formal ways, thus demonstrating the powerful range and capabilities of mankind to create language.

+++ SIZE +++
9.125" wide x 12" high x 1.5" deep

+++ MEDIUM +++
RAM, screws, enamel paint on rescued wood

+++ ORIGINAL +++
This is an original sculpture signed by the artist.

+++ GUARANTEE +++
The artist has personally created and signed this sculpture so you are guaranteed the highest quality art. Satisfaction is guaranteed or a refund (minus shipping costs) will be given.

+++ BIO +++
Erik Maldre, 31, born and raised in Chicago, Illinois USA has a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree from Illinois Wesleyan University. His work has been exhibited in a variety of locations from the conceptual Fassbender Gallery in Chicago to various site installations in churches in the Chicagoland area. His art is found in collections nationally and internationally including England and Spain. He currently resides in a near-west suburb of Chicago and works full-time as a Senior Art Director.

Erik's blog is updated every single weekday at unlikelymoose.com/blog. You'll find discussions about art, design, technology and a lot more in-between. It's a Chicago-style hot dog blog.

+++ COPYRIGHT +++
All artwork by Erik Maldre is copyrighted and may not be produced in any form without his written permission. All rights of reproduction stay with Erik Maldre.

name: Gray Monkey 262
description:
+++ TITLE +++
"Gray Monkey 262" from the "Urban Monkey" series. This is the first sculpture from this series.

+++ ARTIST +++
Erik Maldre

+++ ARTIST STATEMENT +++
Currently under development

+++ SIZE +++
9" height x 4" width x 3" depth

+++ MEDIUM +++
reclaimed wood, spray paint, monkey

NOTE: THE PLASTIC MONKEY IS LOOSE. IT IS NOT GLUED, NAILED, OR PERMANENTLY IN PLACE. The intent is for the monkey figure to be repositioned within its carved environment within the wood block.

+++ ORIGINAL +++
This is an original sculpture signed on the back by the artist.

+++ GUARANTEE +++
The artist has personally created and signed this sculpture so you are guaranteed the highest quality art. Satisfaction is guaranteed or a refund (minus shipping costs) will be given.

+++ COPYRIGHT +++
All rights of reproduction stay with Erik Maldre and are not transferred with purchase.

name: Chicago on a Stick (The Road to Chicago)
description: ARTIST: Erik Maldre SIZE: 8" x 10" x 0.625" ORIGINAL: This is an original hand painted canvas stretched and ready to hang complete with hanging wire. (There's no staples on the side.) Due to its unique nature, subtle differences will appear from one canvas to another. Each painting is signed and numbered by the artist. CUSTOM ORDERS: Commissions for any state or country are welcome. Visit the "Contact" page to send your request.
